text: Vita Ansgarii is the hagiography of saint Ansgar, written by Rimbert, his successor as archbishop in the Prince-Archbishopric of Bremen. Written in about 875 CE, the Vita is an important source in not only detailing Ansgar's missionary work in Scandinavia but in its descriptions of the everyday lives of people during the Viking Age. ==References== == External links == * Vita Ansgari, English translation from Medieval sourcebook Category:Christian hagiography Category:Viking Age Category:Biographies about religious figures Category:9th-century Latin books Category:875 Category:Anglo-Norse people Category:Bishops of Bremen
